meanings.definition: To shout or call out loudly to someone
meanings.sent1: She was halloing for her lost dog in the park.
meanings.sent2: The children were halloing with joy as they played outside.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started halloing back at the noisy kids.
meanings.sent4: His voice halloing across the valley, reaching every corner.
meanings.sent5: The coach was halloing instructions to the players during the game.

meanings.definition: The act of shouting or calling out loudly to someone
meanings.sent1: The halloing from the crowd could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: His halloing echoed through the empty streets at night.
meanings.sent3: The sudden halloing startled the sleeping cat on the porch.
meanings.sent4: The halloing of the fans filled the stadium with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The halloing of the protesters could be heard throughout the city.
